naming_conventions.variables: snake_case for Python, camelCase for JS/Java
naming_conventions.functions_methods: snake_case for Python, camelCase for JS/Java

comments.style: Use comments to explain why, not what. Use # in Python, // in JS/Java.
comments.docstrings: All public functions and classes should have docstrings.

general.error_handling: Use try/except wisely; provide meaningful error messages.
general.logging: Use logging instead of print statements in production code.
general.security: Do not hardcode secrets; validate external inputs.

python.imports: Standard library first, then third-party, then local modules.
python.typing: Use type hints for public functions.
python.linting: Use flake8 or pylint for consistent style.

testing.coverage: Aim for at least 80% test coverage

git.pull_requests: All PRs must be reviewed and pass CI tests

best_practices.code_reviews: Always request review; provide constructive comments.
best_practices.refactoring: Refactor incrementally, avoid large unrelated changes.
best_practices.performance: Avoid premature optimization; measure performance if necessary.
